column4: What's the current status of software audio mixing in Ubuntu?  e.g. on a machine with on-board audio that can only handle one audio playback stream at a time, does ALSA or some other component mix multiple sounds?
e.g. system sounds while music is playing
What I'm talking about is just the ability to play more than one sound at a time, e.g. an IM alert while music is playing, as Windows can, regardless of the capabilities of the audio hardware.
pulseaudio is popular these days. esd compatible. anyway, the only problems are with annoying applications that only support oss, like flash.
